intro: Yushania tongpeii, commonly known as the Yushania grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in China, Myanmar, and Thailand. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and bamboo groves. Yushania tongpeii has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It plays an important ecological role in maintaining soil stability and supporting local biodiversity.
